code: @Manual{,   title = {flightanalysis: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping},   author = {Kaya Celebi and Rémi Thériault},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/rempsyc/flightanalysis}, }

title: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping
text: R package analyzing, forecasting, collecting flight data prices Google Flights.

title: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping
text: Detailed scraping querying tools Google Flights using chromote Support multiple trip types: one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain Flexible date search across multiple airports date ranges Summary tables showing prices city date Automatic identification cheapest travel dates

title: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping
text: can install development version flightanalysis GitHub:
code: install.packages('flightanalysis',    repos = c('https://rempsyc.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Or if you need the version from the last hour, install through `remotes` # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rempsyc/flightanalysis")

what: Creating Flight Queries and Fetching the Data
title: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping
text: main scraping function makes backbone functionalities fa_define_query(). serves data object, preserving flight information well meta-data query. fa_fetch_flights() fetches flight information query. package supports multiple trip types: One-way: fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-07-20") Round-trip: fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-07-20", "2025-08-20") Chain-trip: fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-08-20", "RDU", "LGA", "2025-12-25") Perfect-chain: fa_define_query("JFK", "2025-09-20", "IST", "2025-09-25", "JFK")
code: # Round-trip query <- fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-12-20", "2026-01-05") query ## Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} ## 2025-12-20: JFK --> IST ## 2026-01-05: IST --> JFK ## ) # Fetch the flight data flights <- fa_fetch_flights(query) ##   Segment 1/2: JFK -> IST on 2025-12-20 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 8 flights ##   Segment 2/2: IST -> JFK on 2026-01-05 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 8 flights ##   [OK] Total flights retrieved: 16 # View the flight data head(flights$data[1:11]) |>   knitr::kable()

title: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping
text: package supports flexible date search across multiple airports dates:
code: # Create query objects for multiple origins and dates queries <- fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-22" )  # Fetch all flights flights <- fa_fetch_flights(queries) ## Scraping 2 objects... ##  ## [1/2]   Segment 1/5: BOM -> JFK on 2025-12-18 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 13 flights ##   Segment 2/5: BOM -> JFK on 2025-12-19 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 12 flights ##   Segment 3/5: BOM -> JFK on 2025-12-20 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 9 flights ##   Segment 4/5: BOM -> JFK on 2025-12-21 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 8 flights ##   Segment 5/5: BOM -> JFK on 2025-12-22 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 8 flights ##   [OK] Total flights retrieved: 50 ## [2/2]   Segment 1/5: DEL -> JFK on 2025-12-18 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 8 flights ##   Segment 2/5: DEL -> JFK on 2025-12-19 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 10 flights ##   Segment 3/5: DEL -> JFK on 2025-12-20 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 9 flights ##   Segment 4/5: DEL -> JFK on 2025-12-21 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 9 flights ##   Segment 5/5: DEL -> JFK on 2025-12-22 ##   [OK] Successfully parsed 9 flights ##   [OK] Total flights retrieved: 45 # Create summary table (City × Date with prices) fa_summarize_prices(flights) |>   knitr::kable() # Find the cheapest dates fa_find_best_dates(   flights,    n = 5,   by = "min",   price_max = 1400,   max_stops = 1,   travel_time_max = 26  # 26 hours (numeric = hours, or use "26 hr" format)   ) |>   knitr::kable()

title: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping
text: Credits: package R implementation inspired original Python package google-flight-analysis Kaya Celebi.

title: Create Flight Results Object — create_flight_results

what: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
title: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes

title: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
text: scrapes single query object, flight_results object, named list query objects

title: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
text: data frame columns: Airport, Date, Price, City (named list),   additional columns: departure_datetime, airlines, travel_time, num_stops,   layover, co2_emission_kg (available)

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
text: Defines flight query Google Flights. Supports one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain trip types.

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
text: ... Arguments defining trip. Format depends trip type: - One-way: origin, dest, date - Round-trip: origin, dest, date_leave, date_return - Chain-trip: org1, dest1, date1, org2, dest2, date2, ... - Perfect-chain: org1, date1, org2, date2, ..., final_dest

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
text: flight query object (S3 class "flight_query")

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
code: # One-way trip fa_define_query("JFK", "BOS", "2025-12-20") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> BOS #> )  # Round-trip fa_define_query("JFK", "YUL", "2025-12-20", "2025-12-25") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> YUL #> 2025-12-25: YUL --> JFK #> )  # Chain-trip fa_define_query("JFK", "YYZ", "2025-12-20", "RDU", "LGA", "2025-12-25") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> YYZ #> 2025-12-25: RDU --> LGA #> )

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
text: Creates flight queries multiple origin airports across date range. helper function generates permutations origins dates without actually fetching data. origin gets query object. Similar fa_define_query date ranges.

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
text: origin Character vector 3-letter airport codes search . dest Character. 3-letter destination airport code. date_min Character Date. Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. date_max Character Date. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format.

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
text: single origin: flight query object containing dates.   multiple origins: named list flight query objects, one per origin.

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
code: # Single origin - returns one query object fa_define_query_range(   origin = "BOM",   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-20" ) #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: BOM --> JFK #> )  # Multiple origins - returns named list of query objects fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-20" ) #> $BOM #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: BOM --> JFK #> ) #> $DEL #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: DEL --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: DEL --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: DEL --> JFK #> )

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
text: Fetches flight data Google Flights using chromote. function automatically set Chrome browser connection, navigate Google Flights URLs, extract flight information. Uses Chrome DevTools Protocol reliable, driver-free browser automation. browser runs headless mode default (visible GUI).

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
text: queries flight query object list query objects (fa_define_query()) verbose Logical. TRUE, shows detailed progress information (default)

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
text: Modified query object(s) flight data. **Important:** must   capture return value get flight data: `result <- fa_fetch_flights(query)`

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ query <- fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-12-20", "2025-12-25") flights <- fa_fetch_flights(query) flights$data } # }

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
text: Identifies returns top N dates cheapest average prices across routes. helps quickly identify best travel dates planning flexible trip. Supports filtering various criteria departure time, airlines, travel time, stops, emissions.

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
code: fa_find_best_dates(   flight_results,   n = 10,   by = "min",   time_min = NULL,   time_max = NULL,   airlines = NULL,   price_min = NULL,   price_max = NULL,   travel_time_max = NULL,   max_stops = NULL,   max_layover = NULL,   max_emissions = NULL )

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
text: flight_results Either: - data frame columns: Date Price (optionally filter columns) - flight_results object (fa_fetch_flights multiple origins) - list flight queries (fa_define_query_range multiple origins) - single flight query (fa_define_query_range single origin) n Integer. Number best dates return. Default 10. Character. calculate best dates: "mean" (average price across routes), "median", "min" (lowest price date). Default "min". time_min Character. Minimum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). time_max Character. Maximum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). airlines Character vector. Filter specific airlines. Default NULL (filter). price_min Numeric. Minimum price. Default NULL (filter). price_max Numeric. Maximum price. Default NULL (filter). travel_time_max Numeric character. Maximum travel time. numeric, interpreted hours. character, use format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_stops Integer. Maximum number stops. Default NULL (filter). max_layover Character. Maximum layover time format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_emissions Numeric. Maximum CO2 emissions kg. Default NULL (filter).

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
text: data frame columns: departure_date, departure_time (date datetime available),   origin, price (average/median/min), n_routes, num_stops, layover,   travel_time, co2_emission_kg, airlines, arrival_date, arrival_time. column names lowercase.   Returns top N dates best (lowest) prices, sorted departure time display.   Additional columns aggregated using mean/median numeric values common value categorical.   Note: arrival_date arrival_time represent common values multiple flights aggregated   may correspond exactly specific departure times shown.

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
code: # Find best dates fa_find_best_dates(sample_flights, n = 3, by = "min") #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin price #> 1     2025-12-20          09:00   2025-12-20        22:00    JFK   650 #> 2     2025-12-20          22:00   2025-12-21        11:30    JFK   580 #> 3     2025-12-27          08:30   2025-12-27        21:15    IST   620 #>   num_stops         layover  travel_time co2_emission_kg            airlines #> 1         0            <NA>  13 hr 0 min             550    Turkish Airlines #> 2         1 3 hr 15 min WAW 13 hr 30 min             600 LOT Polish Airlines #> 3         0            <NA> 12 hr 45 min             540    Turkish Airlines #>   n_routes #> 1        1 #> 2        1 #> 3        1  # With filters fa_find_best_dates(   sample_flights,   n = 2,   max_stops = 0 ) #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin price #> 1     2025-12-20          09:00   2025-12-20        22:00    JFK   650 #> 2     2025-12-27          08:30   2025-12-27        21:15    IST   620 #>   num_stops  travel_time co2_emission_kg         airlines n_routes #> 1         0  13 hr 0 min             550 Turkish Airlines        1 #> 2         0 12 hr 45 min             540 Turkish Airlines        1

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
text: Creates wide summary table showing prices city/airport date, average price column. multiple flights exist date, uses minimum (cheapest) price. useful visualizing price patterns across multiple dates comparing different origin airports. Supports filtering various criteria departure time, airlines, travel time, stops, emissions.

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
code: fa_summarize_prices(   flight_results,   include_comment = TRUE,   currency_symbol = "$",   round_prices = TRUE,   time_min = NULL,   time_max = NULL,   airlines = NULL,   price_min = NULL,   price_max = NULL,   travel_time_max = NULL,   max_stops = NULL,   max_layover = NULL,   max_emissions = NULL )

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
text: flight_results Either: - data frame columns: Date Price (optionally filter columns) - flight_results object (fa_fetch_flights multiple origins) - list flight queries (fa_define_query_range multiple origins) - single flight query (fa_define_query_range single origin) include_comment Logical. TRUE Comment column exists, includes output. Default TRUE. currency_symbol Character. Currency symbol use formatting. Default "$". round_prices Logical. TRUE, rounds prices nearest integer. Default TRUE. time_min Character. Minimum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). time_max Character. Maximum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). airlines Character vector. Filter specific airlines. Default NULL (filter). price_min Numeric. Minimum price. Default NULL (filter). price_max Numeric. Maximum price. Default NULL (filter). travel_time_max Numeric character. Maximum travel time. numeric, interpreted hours. character, use format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_stops Integer. Maximum number stops. Default NULL (filter). max_layover Character. Maximum layover time format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_emissions Numeric. Maximum CO2 emissions kg. Default NULL (filter).

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
text: wide data frame columns: City, Origin, Comment (optional),   one column per date prices, Average_Price column.

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
code: # Create summary table fa_summarize_prices(sample_flights) #>   City Origin 2025-12-20 2025-12-21 2025-12-27 Average_Price #> 1  JFK    JFK       $580       $695       <NA>          $638 #> 2  IST    IST       <NA>       <NA>       $620          $620 #> 3 Best    Day          X                                      # With filters fa_summarize_prices(   sample_flights,   max_stops = 0 ) #>   City Origin 2025-12-20 2025-12-27 Average_Price #> 1  JFK    JFK       $650       <NA>          $650 #> 2  IST    IST       <NA>       $620          $620 #> 3 Best    Day                     X

what: flightanalysis: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping — flightanalysis-package
title: flightanalysis: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping — flightanalysis-package
text: Tools models users analyze, forecast, collect data regarding flights prices. Features include detailed scraping querying tools Google Flights, ability store data locally SQL tables, base analytical tools/methods price forecasting/summary. package provides tools models users analyze, forecast, collect data regarding flights prices. Current features include: Detailed scraping querying tools Google Flights Support multiple trip types (one-way, round-trip, chain, perfect-chain) Flexible date search across multiple airports date ranges Summary tables best date identification travel planning Base analytical tools/methods price forecasting/summary

title: flightanalysis: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping — flightanalysis-package
text: fa_define_query Create flight query object fa_fetch_flights Execute flight queries (requires chromote) fa_define_query_range Create queries flexible date search fa_summarize_prices Create wide summary table price comparison fa_find_best_dates Identify cheapest travel dates

title: flightanalysis: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping — flightanalysis-package
text: package supports multiple trip types: One-way: Single flight origin destination Round-trip: Flight destination return Chain-trip: Sequence unrelated one-way flights Perfect-chain: Sequence destination becomes next origin

title: flightanalysis: Google Flight Analysis and Scraping — flightanalysis-package
text: Maintainer: Rémi Thériault remi.theriault@mail.mcgill.ca (ORCID) Authors: Kaya Celebi kayacelebi17@gmail.com [funder]

title: Sample Flight Data — sample_flights
text: Sample flight data testing analysis functions like `fa_find_best_dates()` `fa_summarize_prices()` without internet access.

title: Sample Flight Data — sample_flights
text: data frame 6 rows 14 variables: departure_date Character, departure date (YYYY-MM-DD) departure_time Character, departure time (HH:MM) arrival_date Character, arrival date (YYYY-MM-DD) arrival_time Character, arrival time (HH:MM) origin Character, 3-letter origin airport code destination Character, 3-letter destination airport code airlines Character, airline name(s) travel_time Character, total travel time price Numeric, ticket price USD num_stops Integer, number stops layover Character, layover details (NA nonstop) access_date Character, data accessed co2_emission_kg Numeric, CO2 emissions kg emission_diff_pct Numeric, emission difference percentage

title: Sample Flight Data — sample_flights
code: data(sample_flights) head(sample_flights) #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin destination #> 1     2025-12-20          09:00   2025-12-20        22:00    JFK         IST #> 2     2025-12-20          14:30   2025-12-21        03:45    JFK         IST #> 3     2025-12-20          22:00   2025-12-21        11:30    JFK         IST #> 4     2025-12-21          10:15   2025-12-21        23:30    JFK         IST #> 5     2025-12-27          08:30   2025-12-27        21:15    IST         JFK #> 6     2025-12-27          15:45   2025-12-28        05:00    IST         JFK #>              airlines  travel_time price num_stops         layover #> 1    Turkish Airlines  13 hr 0 min   650         0            <NA> #> 2           Lufthansa 13 hr 15 min   720         1 2 hr 30 min FRA #> 3 LOT Polish Airlines 13 hr 30 min   580         1 3 hr 15 min WAW #> 4          Air France 13 hr 15 min   695         1 2 hr 45 min CDG #> 5    Turkish Airlines 12 hr 45 min   620         0            <NA> #> 6     United Airlines 13 hr 15 min   685         1 3 hr 10 min EWR #>           access_date co2_emission_kg emission_diff_pct #> 1 2025-11-15 18:06:44             550                 5 #> 2 2025-11-15 18:06:44             580                10 #> 3 2025-11-15 18:06:44             600                15 #> 4 2025-11-15 18:06:44             570                 8 #> 5 2025-11-15 18:06:44             540                 3 #> 6 2025-11-15 18:06:44             575                 9 # Use with analysis functions directly fa_find_best_dates(sample_flights, n = 3) #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin price #> 1     2025-12-20          09:00   2025-12-20        22:00    JFK   650 #> 2     2025-12-20          22:00   2025-12-21        11:30    JFK   580 #> 3     2025-12-27          08:30   2025-12-27        21:15    IST   620 #>   num_stops         layover  travel_time co2_emission_kg            airlines #> 1         0            <NA>  13 hr 0 min             550    Turkish Airlines #> 2         1 3 hr 15 min WAW 13 hr 30 min             600 LOT Polish Airlines #> 3         0            <NA> 12 hr 45 min             540    Turkish Airlines #>   n_routes #> 1        1 #> 2        1 #> 3        1 fa_summarize_prices(sample_flights) #>   City Origin 2025-12-20 2025-12-21 2025-12-27 Average_Price #> 1  JFK    JFK       $580       $695       <NA>          $638 #> 2  IST    IST       <NA>       <NA>       $620          $620 #> 3 Best    Day          X

text: named list 2 flight_query objects (BOM DEL JFK) BOM query object Mumbai (BOM) JFK DEL query object Delhi (DEL) JFK

title: Sample Multiple Origin Queries — sample_multi_origin

title: Sample Flight Query — sample_query
text: sample flight query object created `fa_define_query()`. Useful testing documentation examples without making API calls.

title: Sample Flight Query — sample_query
text: flight_query object JFK IST round-trip origin List origin airport codes dest List destination airport codes dates List travel dates type Trip type (round-trip) url Google Flights URLs

title: Sample Flight Query — sample_query
code: data(sample_query) str(sample_query) #> List of 6 #>  $ origin:List of 2 #>   ..$ : chr "JFK" #>   ..$ : chr "IST" #>  $ dest  :List of 2 #>   ..$ : chr "IST" #>   ..$ : chr "JFK" #>  $ date  :List of 2 #>   ..$ : chr "2025-12-20" #>   ..$ : chr "2025-12-27" #>  $ data  :'data.frame':	0 obs. of  0 variables #>  $ url   :List of 2 #>   ..$ : chr "https://www.google.com/travel/flights?hl=en&q=Flights%20to%20IST%20from%20JFK%20on%202025-12-20%20oneway" #>   ..$ : chr "https://www.google.com/travel/flights?hl=en&q=Flights%20to%20JFK%20from%20IST%20on%202025-12-27%20oneway" #>  $ type  : chr "round-trip" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "flight_query" print(sample_query) #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> IST #> 2025-12-27: IST --> JFK #> )

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0 (Development)
text: Function Rename: fa_create_date_range() renamed fa_define_query_range() consistency fa_define_query(). old function removed.

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0 (Development)
text: Contains merged $data field flight data accessible directly Preserves individual query objects named elements (e.g., $BOM, $DEL) dedicated print method better display

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0 (Development)
text: Parameter Renaming: fa_summarize_prices() fa_find_best_dates() now use flight_results parameter name instead results clarity type safety Improved Documentation: Updated examples documentation use new function names Better Data Access: need manually merge data multiple origins - access unified data via flights$data directly

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0 (Development)
code: # Create queries for multiple origins queries <- fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-22" )  # Fetch data - returns flight_results object with merged data flights <- fa_fetch_flights(queries)  # Access merged data directly flights$data  # Or access individual origin data flights$BOM$data flights$DEL$data  # Use with analysis functions fa_summarize_prices(flights) fa_find_best_dates(flights, n = 5)

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: release represents complete redesign package API following Tidyverse conventions consistent fa_ prefixing user-facing functions.

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: Query Creation: - fa_define_query() - Create flight query objects one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain searches - fa_define_query_range() - Create query objects multiple origins dates Data Fetching: - fa_fetch_flights() - Fetch flight data Google Flights using chromote Analysis Functions: - fa_summarize_prices() - Create wide summary table showing prices city/airport date - fa_find_best_dates() - Identify cheapest travel dates across routes

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
code: library(flightanalysis)  # Create a query query <- fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-12-20", "2025-12-27")  # Fetch flight data result <- fa_fetch_flights(query)  # Analyze results summary <- fa_summarize_prices(result) best <- fa_find_best_dates(result, n = 5)

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
code: # Search multiple origins over a date range queries <- fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL", "VNS"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2026-01-05" )  # Fetch data for each origin for (code in names(queries)) {   queries[[code]] <- fa_fetch_flights(queries[[code]]) }  # Analyze all results summary <- fa_summarize_prices(queries) best_dates <- fa_find_best_dates(queries, n = 10, by = "mean")

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: following functions internal exported: - Flight() - Used internally parsing scraped data - flights_to_dataframe() - Converts flight objects data frames

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: fa_define_query_range.R - Date range query creation fa_summarize_prices.R - Price summary tables fa_find_best_dates.R - Best date identification filter_placeholder_rows.R - Data cleaning helpers scrape.R - Core query fetching functionality Comprehensive examples examples/ directory Full test coverage tests/testthat/ Suggested dependencies: chromote, progress

title: flightanalysis 1.0.0
text: Initial CRAN-ready release Full R package implementation chromote-based scraping Support one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain queries Driver-free browser automation using Chrome DevTools Protocol
